description.narrative: Children and their families, particularly in selected districts, are better informed and motivated to practice good hygiene and sanitation, which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable groups have increased access to safe and affordable water supply, sanitation, and hygiene

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and their families, particularly in selected districts, are better informed and motivated to practice good hygiene and sanitation

description.narrative: A national cross-sectoral study of adolescent girls' perceptions of the provision of menstrual health and hygiene services in schools was undertaken. The findings should improve planning for MHH services in schools as well as provide an evidence-base for advocacy to improve MHH services in schools. At the request of the Ministry of Health, UNICEF documented Njombe district's accelerated approach to open defecation free status producing a multi-media package of learning materials to enable other districts to replicate Njombe's approach. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of villages with at least one community platform supported by UNICEF to facilitate sustained community engagement and dialogue on WASH priority behaviors
Number of schools with Menstrual Hygiene Management implemented in schools programmes as a result of UNICEF direct support and/or leveraged through national programmes
Number of communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
